review: All in all, I find that the Fire TV stick is less intuitive and user-friendly than the Roku stick.  It works, it does everything Roku does (and some Amazon specific things Roku doesn't), but it takes some time to get it set up and learn how to navigate properly.  It is fast and portable and works well with Netflix.  The one thing it has over Roku, however, is portability.  All in all, I would normally give this 3 stars, compared to a Roku stick, but added one star for portability.  To go portable with Roku, you have to bring a router with you and the remote.  I got the Fire TV Stick because my family can take it with us when we travel, connect to any wireless network , and we can use the smartphone app in case we forget to bring the remote.  In the arena of portability, the Fire TV Stick is king.
